title: Unlawful use of license
context: §286-131 Unlawful use of license. No person shall: (1) Display or permit to be displayed or have in the person&rsquo;s possession any canceled, revoked, suspended, fictitious, or fraudulently altered driver&rsquo;s license; (2) Lend the person&rsquo;s driver&rsquo;s license to any other person or knowingly permit the use thereof by another; (3) Display or represent as one&rsquo;s own any driver&rsquo;s license not issued to the person; (4) Fail or refuse to surrender to the examiner of drivers, upon the examiner&rsquo;s lawful demand, any driver&rsquo;s license that has been suspended, revoked, or canceled; (5) Use a false or fictitious name in any application for a driver&rsquo;s license or knowingly make a false statement or knowingly conceal a material fact, or otherwise commit a fraud in any such application; or (6) Use or have in the person&rsquo;s possession any reproduction, imitation, or facsimile of any driver&rsquo;s license or any identification with the appearance of a driver&rsquo;s license. [L 1937, c 234, §28; RL 1945, §7329; RL 1955, §160-61; HRS §286-131; am L 1970, c 164, §3; gen ch 1985; am L 1994, c 46, §1; am L 1996, c 169, §1; am L 2001, c 230, §2; am L 2002, c 224, §3; am L 2004, c 2, §1]
